newsitem.title: COLOMBIA: Colombia's Granahorrar eyes U.S. bond issue.
newsitem.headline: Colombia's Granahorrar eyes U.S. bond issue.

text.p: Corporacion Colombiana de Ahorro y Vivienda S.A. (Granahorrar) -- Colombia's third-largest savings and loan -- plans to raise $100 million in financing from institutional investors in the United States through a bond issue set for January, its president said Tuesday.

Jorge Enrique Amaya said Bear Stearns had provided guidance for the planned flotation of the peso-denomimated bonds, which would be backed by Granahorrar's loan portfolio and could be traded on secondary markets in the United States.
Th operation will be the first of its kind by a Colombian savings and loan, or thrift, and could lead to more bond issues in the near future, Amaya told Reuters in a telephone interview.

Granahorrar is owned by a group of about 100 private sector businessmen and investors. Amaya said interest on the bonds would vary, depending on the rate of repayment of the company's outstanding loans.
"Risk will be carried by the financial entity and not the investor," he added, saying the $100 million would be used to expand Granahorrar's loan capacity.
